column4: hello. I have a friend with a MacBook 4 and it has a mouse pad sensitivity problem just like the one described here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1417655 if she uses just the tip of her finger it won't work, She has to use her entire fingerprint in order to get it to respond. In Mac OS she could use her fingernail.
Can anyone figure out how to fix this.
I tried adjusting mouse sensitivity but that only made it faster.
I'm sure someone has had this problem on a PC touchpad too
I dont
you don't have this problem on a MacBook 4 ?
I dont have that problem with any pads
what he means is put that option in the grub line that says GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="quiet splash
ActionParsnip let me make sure I get it right. It's not my PC.
ActionParsnip Ya I got that part just a sec guys
once you add that bit actionparsnip says then save file and issue update-grub
ActionParsnip ok I got my grub.cfg file open
ActionParsnip GRUB_CMDLINE not found when I search
edit this /etc/default/grub
ActionParsnip ya that makes sense
ActionParsnip so what do these options do at boot?
ActionParsnip so you have no idea what will happen? It seems to me the main problem is the driver being used to drive the touchpad
ActionParsnip I think a different driver should be used but I have no idea what one or how to change it.
google is your friend
ActionParsnip Ya I've been googling
http://linuxwisdom.blogspot.com/2007/07/macbooksynaptics-trackpad-configuration.html
im pretty sure google has more on that
